question.title: What is typically seen on radiographs of the knee in cases of microcrystalline arthropathies?
question.description: A radiographic finding characteristic of microcrystalline arthropathies

option_a.title: Meniscal calcification and osteoarthritis
option_a.description: A common radiographic finding in microcrystalline arthropathies

option_b.title: Cartilage calcification and meniscal tears
option_b.description: A characteristic radiographic feature of microcrystalline arthropathies

option_c.title: Osteoporosis and joint space narrowing
option_c.description: Radiographic findings more commonly associated with other conditions

option_d.title: Meniscal calcification and osteoarthritis
option_d.description: A radiographic finding characteristic of osteoarthritis, not microcrystalline arthropathies

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
